meanings.definition: To take away or deduct (a number or amount) from another number or amount.
meanings.sent1: She subtracts 2 from 5 to find the answer.
meanings.sent2: He always subtracts the cost of shipping from the total price.
meanings.sent3: The magician subtracts the red scarf from the pile of scarves, leaving only blue ones.
meanings.sent4: Time subtracts the innocence of childhood from us all.
meanings.sent5: The teacher subtracts the incorrect answers to reveal the correct solution.

meanings.definition: To remove or decrease something from a whole.
meanings.sent1: The chef subtracts the salt from the recipe to make it healthier.
meanings.sent2: The storm subtracts the leaves from the trees, leaving them bare.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel subtracts the nuts from the pile, playing a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Laughter subtracts the weight of sorrow from our hearts.
meanings.sent5: The artist subtracts the unnecessary details to reveal the essence of the painting.
